"American Sniper" is a 2014 American biographical drama film directed by Clint Eastwood and written by Billy Ray Cyrus and Scott Adams.
The movie tells the story of Chris Kyle (played by Bradley Cooper), an American Navy SEAL who is credited with being the most accurate sniper in U.S. military history, also known as American Sniper or simply Kyle.
Throughout his career, Chris Kyle served on three tours of duty in Iraq during the 2003 - 2019 Iraq War.
In addition to his military service, Chris Kyle also wrote two books about his experiences as a Navy SEAL and as a survivor of the 2004 Indian Ocean Tsunami.
